triggers.name: Daily recommended Applet for you
triggers.description: This trigger recommends a new Applet every day at the time you specify.

triggers.name: New service activated by you
triggers.description: This trigger fires every time you activate a new service on IFTTT.

triggers.name: New tweet by you
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time you post a new tweet.

triggers.name: New tweet by you with hashtag
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time you post a new tweet with a specific hashtag.

triggers.name: New tweet by you in area
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time you post a tweet at a location you specify.

triggers.name: New tweet by a specific user
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time the Twitter user you specify tweets.

triggers.name: New tweet from search
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time a new tweet matches your search query. NOTE: limited to 15 tweets per check.

triggers.name: New tweet by anyone in area
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time anyone posts a tweet at a location you specify.

actions.name: Post a tweet
actions.description: This Action will post a new tweet to your Twitter account. NOTE: Please adhere to Twitter’s Rules and Terms of Service.

actions.name: Post a tweet with image
actions.description: This Action will post a new tweet to your Twitter account with a linked pic.twitter.com image. NOTE: Please adhere to Twitter’s Rules and Terms of Service.

actions.name: Send a direct message to yourself
actions.description: This Action will send a direct message to your Twitter account. NOTE: Please adhere to Twitter’s Rules and Terms of Service.

actions.name: Update profile picture
actions.description: This Action will update your profile picture from the image URL you specify and optionally tweet about it. NOTE: Please adhere to Twitter’s Rules and Terms of Service.

actions.name: Update bio
actions.description: This Action will update your bio and optionally tweet about it. NOTE: Please adhere to Twitter’s Rules and Terms of Service.

actions.name: Add user to list
actions.description: This Action will add a user to a Twitter list you specify. NOTE: Twitter allows 1000 lists per user and 5000 users per list.

triggers.name: Every day at
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every single day at a specific time set by you.

triggers.name: Every hour at
triggers.description: This Trigger fires once an hour at :00, :15, :30, or :45 minutes past the hour.

triggers.name: Every day of the week at
triggers.description: This Trigger fires only on specific days of the week at the time you provide.

triggers.name: Every month on the
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every month on the day and time you specify.

triggers.name: Every year on
triggers.description: This Trigger fires once a year on the date and time you specify.

triggers.name: New feed item
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time a new item is added to the feed you specify.

triggers.name: New feed item matches
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time a new item in the feed you specify contains a particular keyword or simple phrase.

triggers.name: Send IFTTT an SMS tagged
triggers.description: Send IFTTT a tagged SMS by adding a hashtag symbol anywhere in the message (e.g. #IFTTT).

actions.name: Send me an SMS
actions.description: This Action will send an SMS to your mobile phone.

triggers.name: Send IFTTT an email tagged
triggers.description: Send IFTTT an email at trigger@applet.ifttt.com with a hashtag in the subject (e.g. #IFTTT) and this Trigger fires. You can optionally add a single file attachment and IFTTT will create a public URL to the file as an Ingredient.

actions.name: Send me an email
actions.description: This Action will send you an HTML based email. Images and links are supported.

triggers.name: Turned On
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time your cloudBit receives an input signal from another littleBits module.

triggers.name: Turned Off
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time your cloudBit's input goes from high to low.

actions.name: Activate Output
actions.description: This Action will activate the output of your cloudBit for 3 seconds.

actions.name: Deactivate Output
actions.description: This Action will deactivate the output of your cloudBit.

actions.name: Set Output Level
actions.description: This Action will set the output of your cloudBit to the specified level for the specified length of time.

triggers.name: Today's weather report
triggers.description: This Trigger retrieves today's current weather report at the time you specify. NOTE: Pollen count available only in the USA.

triggers.name: Tomorrow's weather report
triggers.description: This Trigger retrieves tomorrow's weather report at the time you specify.

triggers.name: Current temperature drops below
triggers.description: This Trigger monitors your local temperature and fires whenever the temperature drops below the value you provide.

triggers.name: Current temperature rises above
triggers.description: This Trigger monitors your local temperature and fires whenever the temperature rises above the value you provide.

triggers.name: Current condition changes to
triggers.description: This Trigger monitors changes in the current weather condition. When one of those conditions is met the Trigger fires. Currently only these simple conditions are supported: Rain, Snow, Cloudy, Clear.

triggers.name: Tomorrow's low drops below
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time tomorrow’s forecasted low temperature drops below a value you provide.

triggers.name: Tomorrow's high rises above
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time tomorrow’s forecasted high temperature rises above a value you provide.

triggers.name: Tomorrow's forecast calls for
triggers.description: This Trigger monitors changes in tomorrow’s forecasted weather condition.

triggers.name: Wind speed rises above
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time the wind speed rises above a value you specify in your location.

triggers.name: Current pollen count rises above
triggers.description: This Trigger monitors your local pollen levels and fires every time the pollen count rises above the value you specify (1-12). NOTE: Available only in the USA.

triggers.name: Current humidity level rises above
triggers.description: This Trigger monitors your local humidity and fires every time the humidity rises above the value you specify.

triggers.name: Current UV index rises above
triggers.description: This Trigger monitors your local UV levels and fires every time the UV index rises above the value you specify (0-16).

triggers.name: Alarm triggered
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when the Smart Alert detects that a smoke or carbon monoxide alarm has gone off in your home.

triggers.name: New sensor reading received
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when the Smart Alert has new temperature and humidity readings available.

triggers.name: Temperature above threshold
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when the Smart Alert detects that your home's temperature has gone above the threshold you've configured.

triggers.name: Temperature below threshold
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when the Smart Alert detects that your home's temperature has gone below the threshold you've configured.

triggers.name: Humidity above threshold
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when the Smart Alert detects that your home's humidity level has gone above the threshold you've configured.

triggers.name: Humidity below threshold
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when the Smart Alert detects that your home's humidity level has gone below the threshold you've configured.

actions.name: Change light color
actions.description: This Action will change the light color of your Smart Alert.

actions.name: Turn light on
actions.description: This Action will turn the light on your Leeo Smart Alert on. It will not affect your Smart Alert's ability to detect alarms or sense temperature or humidity.

actions.name: Turn light off
actions.description: This Action will turn the light on your Leeo Smart Alert off. It will not affect your Smart Alert's ability to detect alarms or sense temperature or humidity.

actions.name: Toggle light on/off
actions.description: This Action will turn the light on your Leeo Smart Alert on if it's off, or off if it's on. It will not affect your Smart Alert's ability to detect alarms or sense temperature or humidity.

actions.name: Call my phone
actions.description: This Action will call your phone number and say a message.

triggers.name: Motion detected
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time your Manything camera detects motion while recording. NOTE: set your camera's sensitivity threshold in the Manything app.

triggers.name: Power disconnected
triggers.description: This Triggers when a device detects that its power has been disconnected.

triggers.name: Power reconnected
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when the power is reconnected to a device.

triggers.name: Battery Low
triggers.description: This Triggers when a device's battery is running low. It will trigger when there's around 20% charge remaining.

actions.name: Start recording
actions.description: This Action will start your Manything camera recording. NOTE: the Manything app must be open at the recording screen on the device you specify.

actions.name: Use front facing camera
actions.description: This Action will change the Manything settings so that video is captured using the front facing camera.

actions.name: Use rear facing camera
actions.description: This Action will change the Manything settings so that video is captured using the rear facing camera.

actions.name: Stop recording
actions.description: This Action will stop your Manything camera from recording further.

actions.name: Turn camera flashlight on
actions.description: This Action will turn the camera's flashlight on (if it has one).

actions.name: Turn camera flashlight off
actions.description: This Action will turn the camera's flashlight off.

actions.name: Mute audio
actions.description: This Action will mute audio for recordings made on a device, so no audio is captured.

actions.name: Unmute audio
actions.description: This Action will turn off mute audio, so that sound is captured when the device is recording.

actions.name: Change to 'Stills Mode'
actions.description: This Action will switch your recording from a video stream to stills only mode, where still images are taken at regular intervals rather than video. Ideal for low bandwidth usage.

actions.name: Change to 'Video Stream'
actions.description: This Action will switch from ”Stills Only Mode” to a video stream. Note: your network bandwidth must be good enough to stream video, and the device may drop back to stills mode automatically if connection is poor.

actions.name: Set time interval between stills
actions.description: This Action will sets the time interval between stills images. This value is only used when the phone is recording in stills mode.

actions.name: Set motion sensitivity threshold
actions.description: This Action will set the motion sensitivity on a device. "1" triggers on small motion events. "10" triggers on big motion events.

actions.name: Set multiple camera settings
actions.description: This Action will set a number of different camera settings at the same time. You don't need to set all the settings, and can leave some as "please select", so they remain unchanged on the device. NOTE: To start a new recording, the app must be open at the recording screen on the device you specify.

triggers.name: Daily goal not achieved by __:__
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time you do not achieve a daily goal you choose at the time you specify. NOTE: Updated on the first Fitbit tracker sync after the time you specify.
attributes: When do you want to have achieved this goal?

triggers.name: Sleep duration above
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time you log sleep above the target hours you specify.

triggers.name: Sleep duration below

actions.name: Log your weight

triggers.name: New trending story
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time a new story is trending. Select how often you want to read stories by specifying Buzzing, Hot, or Viral. The terms correspond to increasing rates of social sharing: Buzzing is more than 100 shares per hour, Hot is more than 500, and Viral is more than 1,000 shares per hour.

triggers.name: New story from section
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time a new story is published in the EW.com section you specify.

actions.description: This Action will set your room temperature to a new set point for a configurable period.

actions.description: This Action will open the garage door you specify. If the garage door is already opened, the door will remain opened. This Action will only work with "garage mode". Remote access must be enabled.

actions.name: Close door
actions.description: This Action will close the garage door you specify. If the garage door is already closed, the door will remain closed. This Action will only work with "garage mode". Remote access must be enabled.

triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time the camera sees something important moving. It will try to ignore shadows, moving tree leaves, and similar 'noise', while still seeing moving cars, pets, and people. triggers.name: Tag is moved
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when specified motion sensor tag(s) armed in motion detection mode, have moved.

triggers.name: Door or window is opened
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when a specified motion sensor tag(s) or reed sensor(s) detect that a door or window is open.

triggers.name: Door or window is closed

triggers.description: This Trigger fires when specified PIR KumoSensor detects movement.

triggers.name: Motion sensor has timed out
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when specified PIR KumoSensor or regular motion sensor tag detects no movement for a time-out period.

triggers.name: Temperature is too high
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when a specified tag senses that its ambient temperature exceeds an upper threshold configured at temperature options screen inside the WirelessTag app.

triggers.name: Temperature is too low
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when a specified tag senses that its ambient temperature falls below an lower threshold configured at temperature options screen inside the WirelessTag app.

triggers.name: Temperature returns to normal
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when a specified tag senses that its ambient temperature returns between the upper and lower thresholds configured at temperature options screen inside the WirelessTag app.

triggers.name: Humidity or moisture is too high
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when a specified tag with humidity or moisture monitoring enabled, detects "too wet" state. Adjust the threshold from the humidity/moisture options screen inside the WirelessTag app.

triggers.name: Humidity or moisture is too low
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when a specified tag with humidity or moisture monitoring enabled, detects "too dry" state. Adjust the threshold from the humidity/moisture options screen inside the WirelessTag app.

triggers.name: Humidity or moisture returns to normal
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when a specified tag with humidity or moisture monitoring enabled, returns within normal humidity range. Adjust the upper/lower thresholds from the humidity/moisture options screen inside the WirelessTag app.

triggers.name: Sensor detects water
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when specified water sensor tag detects water with its resistive sensor, or when you short circuit its tip.

triggers.name: Sensor no longer detects water
triggers.description: This trigger fires when specified water sensor tag transitions from detected water state to not detected water state, or when you open circuit its tip.

triggers.name: Out of range
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when a specified tag goes out of range. Note that the system can only determine whether a tag is out of range, if the "auto-update" is enabled.

triggers.name: Back in range
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when a specified tag comes out of "out of range" state. Only tags with auto-update is enabled can come out of "out of range" state.

triggers.name: Tag Manager Offline
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when the server detects that specified tag manager lost Internet connection due to power outage or Internet connection problems.

triggers.name: Tag Manager Online
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when specified tag manager is back online.

triggers.name: New KumoApp message
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time a specific KumoApp produces a log message with KumoApp.Log call with a specific type.

triggers.name: Update received
triggers.description: This Trigger fires every time a temperature/humidity/lux update is received from specified sensor/tag(s).

triggers.name: Too bright
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when a specified tag senses that its ambient light exceeds an upper threshold configured at light options screen inside the WirelessTag app. For example, this can be used to detect fridge door open.

triggers.name: Too dark
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when a specified tag senses that its ambient light exceeds an lower threshold configured at light options screen inside the WirelessTag app. For example, this can be used to turn on a light in a room.

triggers.name: Brightness returns to normal
triggers.description: This Trigger fires when a specified tag senses that its ambient light intensity returns between the upper and lower thresholds configured at light options screen inside the WirelessTag app.

actions.name: Set indefinite hold
actions.description: This Action will set the thermostat into an indefinite hold with the specified temperature.

actions.name: Set hold until next transition
actions.description: This Action will set the thermostat into a hold with the specified temperature and the end date/time will be set to the next climate transition in the program.

actions.name: Set hold for X hours
actions.description: This Action will set the thermostat into a hold with the specified temperature for the specified number of hours.

actions.name: Create vacation
actions.description: This Action will create a vacation event on the selected thermostat with the specified setpoint. The vacation event will begin immediately and last the number of specified days.

actions.name: Set comfort profile until next transition
actions.description: This Action will set the thermostat into a hold using the settings from the specified comfort profile. This comfort profile hold will remain in effect until the next next comfort profile transition in the program.

actions.name: Set comfort profile for X hours
actions.description: This Action will set the thermostat into a hold using the settings from the specified comfort profile. This comfort profile hold will remain in effect for the specified number of hours.

actions.name: Resume program
actions.description: This Action removes the currently running event on the selected thermostat providing the event is not a mandatory demand response event.

actions.name: Create a page from a link
actions.description: This Action creates a page from a link in the specified section of the specified notebook.

actions.name: Send message
actions.description: This Action will send a new message to a Fleep conversation.
